All you need to know ET Online Last Updated: Sep 13, 2025, 03:09:00 PM IST Rate Story Follow us Share Font Size Abc Small Abc Medium Abc Large Save Print Comment Synopsis The shooting of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University has sparked controversy. It has brought Nick Fuentes and his 'Groyper' movement back into the spotlight. Authorities are investigating the motive behind the attack. Online speculation links the suspect, Tyler Robinson, to Fuentes' group. Fuentes, a far-right leader, has denied any involvement. Nick Fuentes is a antisemite - far-right leader who has often praised Adolf Hitler The shooting of right-wing political conservative activist Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University has reignited attention on far-right figure Nick Fuentes . It has brought back the spotlight on a long-simmering feud within elements of the far right, particularly between Kirk and the so-called "Groyper" movement led by white nationalist Nick Fuentes. As authorities investigate the motive behind the assassination of President Trump's ally, online speculation has turned toward extremist factions that once targeted Kirk—specifically, Fuentes' " Groyper Army ," which has long accused him of being insufficiently radical. Social media claims are now linking the suspect, 22-year-old Tyler Robinson, to Fuentes' 'Groyper' movement. ALSO READ: Who is Skye Valadez and why 'Charlie Kirk dead at 31' song on Soundcloud has sparked buzz on social media? Who is Nick Fuentes? Nick Fuentes is a antisemite - far-right leader who has often praised Adolf Hitler, according to Texas Tribune. A Holocaust denier, he had called for a "holy war" against Jews and compared the 6 million killed by the Nazis to cookies being baked in an oven, the outlet reported. He was born in the Chicago suburbs in 1998. Fuentes dropped out of college after the rally and ramped up his presence on YouTube, often coating his most extreme views in humor and satire. Fuentes’ followers have been nicknamed “groypers” after a cartoon frog that has become a meme in far-right online communities. 'Groypers' often accused Kirk of not being “pro-white” enough. Live Events ALSO READ: Who is Anastasia J. Casey? Mysterious book ‘The Shooting of Charlie Kirk’ surfaces online a day before tragedy “Groypers” would often try to access microphones during Q&A sessions in order to attack Kirk, who helped recruit younger voters to the GOP. He has fantasized about marrying a 16-year-old when he is older. During the 2019 "Groyper Wars," Fuentes' supporters disrupted Turning Point USA events, challenging Kirk on immigration and LGBTQ rights while labeling him a "gatekeeper" of establishment conservatism, reports NewsWeek. What is Groyper Army? The Groyper Army is a far-right, internet-driven movement centered on white nationalist and “America First” figure Nick Fuentes. The Anti-Defamation League (ADL) describes the group as composed of “alt-right, white nationalist, and Christian nationalist activists” who promote deeply antisemitic, racist, and homophobic beliefs, frequently disguising their extremism behind language focused on traditional values and family. Their mascot is a cartoon frog called "Groyper," a variant of the "Pepe" meme used widely among extremist groups. The term "Groyper" gained momentum in 2019 during a public feud inside the conservative movement. That year, followers of Nick Fuentes disrupted college events hosted by Charlie Kirk and his group, Turning Point USA, accusing Kirk of watering down Donald Trump's message. Charlie Kirk responded by calling the Groypers extremists. ALSO READ: Why is Trump's face 'drooping' as latest photos of US President spark health rumours? Check signs Nick Fuentes on Charlie Kirk's shooting Nick Fuentes has made several public statements about Kirk's assassination. Shortly after the killing, Fuentes posted, "I am devastated. It feels like a nightmare that we'll never wake up from," and called for unity, writing, "The violence and hatred has to stop. Our country needs Christ now more than ever." On September 12, Fuentes directed his comments at the Trump administration. "We need more from the Trump administration than what we're getting," he wrote on X. "Release all the information about the assassin and his Discord contacts. Everyone must be investigated. Tell us the plan. How will the government stop this from ever happening again? Where is the leadership???"
